result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose D. Hernandez

records.addlTxt: Order for payment and reimbursement to county- sent to accountant
Re: Order for Payment and Reimbursement to County

3:15 p.m.
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 21CM520, 21CT361, and 22CM786

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo for ADA Kerri Puig; Defendant appears in person with Attorney Dylan Resch.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed. 
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

COURT REOPENS 21TR2599

State moves to: 
21CM520
COUNT 1: Possession of THC >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Possess Drug Paraphernalia >> DRI.
22CM786
COUNT 1: Operating While Revoked (Rev to due alc/contr subst/refusal) >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order >> DRI.
COUNT 3: Bail Jumping, Misd >> DRI.
COUNT 4: Bail Jumping, Misd >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to: 
21CT361
COUNT 1: OWI (2nd) >> NO CONTEST.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT finds refusal in 21TR2599 lawful. 

COURT ORDERS: $1,429.00 fine inclusive; 5 day MCJ with Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination; No objection to EMP; and credit for 9 days for time served. Any vehicle titled or registered in the Defendant's name is subject to IID installation for 12 months.  12 months DL revocation with any administrative credit.  AODA (unless already completed) and f/u.  DNA sample. 6 points.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 9:30 am 
INCLUDES 21CM520, 21CT361, 22CM786, & 21TR2599. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears with Atty Dylan Resch.   
Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing. 
State notes agreement of the parties. 
COURT questions parties re: jail credit. 
OTR: 9:31 am BOTR: 9:32 am 
Parties do not have agreement re: jail credit at this time. 
COURT directs parties to see JA to reset hearing. 
Adj: 9:33 am
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:46 am 
INCLUDES 21CM520, 21CT361, & 22CM786. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Dylan Resch. 

BFH IN 21CM520 & 21CT361. 
Atty Resch makes statement. 
COURT vacates bond forfeiture. 

Atty Resch requests appointment in 22CM786. 
COURT appoints Atty Resch in 22CM786. 
COURT directs parties see JA to set future dates. 
Adj: 9:49 am 

cc: Payment Officer

INCLUDES 22CM786, 21CM520 & 21CT361. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  No driving without an IID.

Case Called: 2:06 pm
INCLUDES 22CM786, 21CM520, 21CT361.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski in person for ADA Kerri Puig.  Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Heather Roehr in person.

VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

BOND: 
$500.00 Signature Bond to cover all files. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
-Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- No driving without valid DL. 
- No Driving without an IID.

DATES:
BFH 08/19 @ 9:00 am

Branch 3 File.
